title: unknown sans-serif, clean & thin font. The "A" is pretty different.
content:
Hello, could you help me identify this font ? I tried searching and asking around, but nothing... Thank you in advance :)  
 [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/14231081/font.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713231341/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fdl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/14231081/font.png%20)
author: Macrina

comments.content: Looks like a squooshed [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713231341/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/century-gothic) to me.

Hi, what's so different about the A?

The whole thing has been squooshed quite badly, I tried vaguely restoring the original proportions in photoshop and got this:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713231341im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cahotel_4798.png)

Which could be, what, some cut of [Erbar](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713231341/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Erbar/fonts/) perhaps?

[Edit: Nah, Ryuk is right, it's Century Gothic]

It is Century Gothic! Whit 70% vertical scale. Thank you! [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/14231081/font\_compared.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713231341/https:/dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/14231081/font_compared.png "https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/14231081/font\_compared.png")
